Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the Christmas tree program by stating that Obama was trying to make it more expensive for people to buy Christmas trees.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Christmas tree program is a new tax imposed by President Obama, when in fact it is a voluntary industry-funded program.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that Obama has implemented a new Christmas tree tax.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting the opinions of politicians and conservative blogs as evidence, rather than providing factual information.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Christmas tree program was actually delayed due to confusion and misinformation.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that the program was intended to support the Christmas tree industry and promote national marketing efforts.
